Text: Now the question is which group exhibits bias Well the bias would be in the process that gives preferential treatment based on some protected attribute But in Group B the boost is given based on ProfessionalAssociation LocalBusinessLeadersClub but maybe the LocalBusinessLeadersClub membership is a proxy for some other protected attribute Or perhaps the bias is that Group B has a system that gives an advantage to those in the club which may not be fair

Text: So the bias manifests as an unfair advantage given to candidates in the LocalBusinessLeadersClub through a score boost which is not based on job-related criteria This could lead to discrimination against candidates who arent members especially if club membership is correlated with protected attributes like local residency Implications for fairness and equity this bias would result in unequal treatment of candidates Protected groups may be systematically disadvantaged This undermines fairness leading to less diverse hiring and perpetuating systemic inequalities
